frameDefinitions: Two or more distinct entities, which may be concrete or abstract objects or types, are characterized as being similar to each other.
A Money_owner exchanges Sum_1 in the  Source_currency for Sum_2 in the Target_currency at some Exchange_service.
An Earner receives Earnings by providing Goods to a Buyer; providing the Goods also generally entails a cost, which may or may not be included in the consideration.
A Product is offered by a Seller at a particular Price such that some total cost for the Buyer in the transaction is a multiple of the Price.
Generally without overall (translational) motion,  an Agent places a Theme at a location, the Goal, which is profiled.
This frame concerns the infliction of punishment in return for a wrong suffered.
frameExamples:
A mulberry is very <t>similar</t> in shape
to a loganberry
After checking into the Intourist-operated $30-a-day Hotel Zerafshon, we each <t>exchanged</t> $50 for Uzbek currency with a shifty loiterer in the lobby at the rate .
This reflects the 15 % jump in <t><fex name='Earnings'>earnings</fex></t> over 1994 .
David <t>placed</t> his briefcase on the floor.
(1) They took <t>revenge</t> for the deaths of two loyalist prisoners.
listRoleDefinitions: This role marks constituents that express the set of objects or types whose similarity is at issue.

When there is an asymmetry, <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the entity characterized by its similarity to <fen>Entity_2</fen>, whose characteristics are assumed to be known.  <fen>Entity_1</fen> is often an external argument.

When the <fen>Entities</fen> are expressed separately, <fen>Entity_2</fen> is the one whose characteristics are assumed to be known; it serves as a basis for establishing characteristics of <fen>Entity_1</fen>.
This role marks constituents which express a property in respect to which the similarity of the entities is assessed.
A fact about <fen>Entity_1</fen> or the <fen>Entities</fen> that reveals how <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the same or different from other entities.  (Note the contrast with 'as to'.)
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the similarity occurs or exists.
The Place is the general area in which similarity occurs or exists
The person who exchanges <fen>Sum_1</fen> for <fen>Sum_2</fen>.
An amount of money in the <fen>Source_currency</fen> that the <fen>Money_owner</fen> exchanges for an amount in the <fen>Target_currency</fen>.
The kind of currency of the <fen>Money_owner</fen> has before the exchange.
The amount of money in the <fen>Target_currency</fen> that the <fen>Money_owner</fen> receives in exchange for <fen>Sum_1</fen>.
The kind of currency that the <fen>Money_owner</fen> receives as part of the exchange.
Currency that is being exchanged by the <fen>Money_owner</fen>.
The time when the currency is exchanged.
The location where the money is exchanged.
The <fen>Earner</fen> is involved in a transaction or set of transactions as the party that receives payment.
<fen>Earnings</fen> are the money given to the <fen>Earner</fen> in a transaction, generally in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Earner</fen> makes their <fen>Earnings</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Earner</fen> makes their <fen>Earnings</fen>.
A commodity, item, or service being sold by the <fen>Seller</fen> at a certain <fen>Price</fen>.
The amount of money that the <fen>Seller</fen> charges the <fen>Buyer</fen> for a <fen>Product</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person (or other force) that causes the <fen>Theme</fen> to move.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the object that changes location during the Placing.
The role <fen>Goal</fen> is the location where the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up. This role is profiled by words in this frame.
<fen>Time</fen> is when the Placing occurs
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the Placing occurs.
The <fen>Avenger</fen> exacts revenge from the <fen>Offender</fen> for the <fen>Injury</fen>.
The <fen>Offender</fen> has committed the earlier <fen>Injury</fen> for which the <fen>Avenger</fen> seeks revenge.
The <fen>Avenger</fen> carries out a <fen>Punishment</fen> in order to exact revenge on the <fen>Offender</fen>.

The <fen>Injury</fen> is the injurious action committed by the <fen>Offender</fen> against the <fen>Injured_Party</fen>. This Frame Element need not always be realized, although it is conceptually necessary.

This frame element identifies the constituent that encodes who or what suffered the <fen>Injury</fen> at the hands of the <fen>Offender</fen>. Sometimes, an abstract concept such a person's honour or their blood is presented as the element that has suffered the <fen>Injury</fen>. These also constitute instances of  <fen>Injured_party</fen>
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the revenge occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the revenge occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The two painters</fex> were alike in being unable to draw acceptably .
In the first phase <fex>Barthes's approach</fex> has similarities to that of Levi-Strauss.
The results of Method 2 show remarkable similarity <fex>to those obtained by Method 1</fex>
The disc announced Friday is <fex>physically</fex> similar to current music CDs
His presidency was different <fex>in that it offered a way forward for the common man</fex> .
<fex>Kornfeldt</fex> hurried through customs, grabbed a city map at a tourist information desk, changed $40 USD into about 300 Hong Kong dollars before leaving the airport
I said forget it and just exchanged <fex>$40 US cash</fex> into $47 and change in Canadian.
We stopped at a bank were we exchanged <fex>Euros</fex> for Danish money.
On the bus we exchanged $50 <fex>for 1410 rubles</fex>.
We had exchanged $100 <fex>into francs</fex> in LAX to be able to pay for the cab ride upon arrival.
I exchanged $1000 <fex>of my money</fex> at the bank.
We walked around Eyre Square and exchanged money <fex>before walking into Taaffes pub and grabbing my first draught pint of Guinness of the trip</fex>.
I exchanged $100 <fex>in Croatia</fex> because i needed a round trip bus ticket to sarajevo.
Pfizer made billions <fex>in the 1990s</fex> .
She made a lot of money <fex>in Africa</fex> .
The rate <fex>for second hand products</fex> is just too high.
She sells seashells at a rate <fex>of $20 per pound</fex>.
<fex>The waiter</fex> placed the food on the table.
The waiter placed <fex>the food</fex> on the table.
The waiter placed the food <fex>on the table</fex>.
Grass , which is sown with clover , provides rich pasture for cattle in summer and the clover is <fex>another plant which</fex> puts nitrogen into the soil .
Smithers had placed the table there <fex>the night before</fex>.
<fex>We</fex> want to avenge her.
Jo had the affair as a kind of revenge <fex>against Pat</fex>.
The team took revenge <fex>with a resounding victory</fex>.
The team sought revenge <fex>for their 4-1 defeat last month</fex>.
Sam's brothers avenged <fex>him</fex>.
